metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15847 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is part of the power9 ISA, and Ubuntu binaries are built with the power8 ISA, so no binaries in the archive are affected  setting priority to negligible eslerm> instruction set implementation for POWER9 began in gcc-6 affected darn instruction set implemented on 2016-06-02 which predates gcc-6.1.0

criterions.comment: gcc-4.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
